definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: However, some people will meet with the problem of whether they should read selectively or extensively.
sentences.chinese: 然而，有些人会碰到应该选读还是泛读的问题。

sentences.english: We need to do some extensive reading.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一些泛读练习。

sentences.english: His eyeglasses magnify phrases so he can read them.
sentences.chinese: 他借助眼睛把字放大以便能够泛读。

sentences.english: Some hold that we should read extensively for getting more knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 一些人认为我们应该泛读，以此来获得更多的知识。

sentences.english: It may be slower, but it forces you to learn instead of just skim.
sentences.chinese: 这会变慢，但它迫使你把掌握代替泛读。
这些文章只须泛读一下。

sentences.english: The learners can develop their language knowledge through extensive reading.
sentences.chinese: 学习者能够通过泛读开发他们的语言知识。

sentences.english: His eyeglasses magnify phrases so he can easyst you.
sentences.chinese: 他借助眼睛把字放大以便能够泛读。

sentences.english: Both intensive reading and extensive reading are needed in learning English.
sentences.chinese: 精读与泛读在英语学习中都不能少。

sentences.english: Reform the classroom teaching structure, make intensive reading with be suffused with to read to combine together.
sentences.chinese: 改革课堂教学结构，使精读与泛读相结合。

sentences.english: All in all, extensive reading takes extremely significant effect in language learning.
sentences.chinese: 总之，泛读在语言学习中有着非常显著的影响。

sentences.english: In English study, intensive reading must be combined with extensive reading.
sentences.chinese: 在英语学习中，精读必须与泛读结合起来。

sentences.english: First of all, reading extensively can enrich us more.
sentences.chinese: 首先，泛读能让我们获得更多的知识。

sentences.english: He selected an extensive reading course this term.
sentences.chinese: 这个学期他选修了泛读课程。

sentences.english: It has been decided that more time be alloted for extensive reading.
sentences.chinese: 已经决定让出更多的时间用于泛读。

definition: new word (in textbook)/word that is unfamiliar or not yet studied/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
(of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
